content: adirondack babie soaker pattern a note on gauge gauge in this pattern is extremely important do not skip doing a gauge swatch…………………… if you have any any problems at all please email me at rebecca@crazyhatlady com i will always answer my emails gauge with h hook 4 x 4 = 17 stitches and 12 row of half_double_crochet alternating in front & back loops materials needed -hook sizes needed for gauge and a hook 1 size smaller i used g & h -worsted weight wool yarn i used malabrigo worsted approximate measurements unstretched personal gauge will affect these measurements size waist hips rise thighs newborn 12 14 14 8 small 13 16 16 9 medium 15 18 18 10 large 17 18 20 11 stitches single_crochet - single_crochet half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet fpdc - front post double_crochet bpdc - back post double_crochet slip_stitch - slip_stitch chain - chain ribbing with smallest hook chain 9 row 1 single_crochet in second chain from hook single_crochet in each chain till end 8 single_crochet chain 1 and turn row 2 single_crochet in the back loop of the each single_crochet not the turning chain 8 single_crochet chain 1 and turn row 3 repeat row 2 until your ribbing measures 12 13 15 17 long from the beginning making sure to end in an even number of row multiples of 2 row 4 bring beginning of ribbing and end of ribbing together do not twist and slip_stitch together to form a circle calculations count how many row you have stitches needed for body 62 68 74 80 cid 11 umber is row is less than number of stitches need for the body subtract the number of row from the total stitches needed for your size now take that number and divide the number of row by it this will give you how many stitches to do an increase random example i am making a nb size and i have 31 row in my ribbing the nb size requires 62 stitches so 62 stitches -31 row of ribbing = 31 stitches need for increasing 31 stitches/31 row needed for increasing equals 1 so you will need to increase every row please note if your calculations do not come out even and you have some remaining stitches to increase for instance you are making a nb size and you have 30 row of ribbing in your waistband so 62 stitches -30 row of ribbing = 32 stitches needed for increasing which gives you 1 with 2 remaining see if you have remaining stitches go to * under the if you need to increase stitches in to start the body section for more explanation if the number of row = the number of stitches needed for the body go to row = stitches in the to start the body section if the number of row is more than the number of stitches need for the body take the number of row of ribbing you have and subtract the number of stitches
